title: 103_hr4818
content: SECTION 1. AMENDMENTS. The Land Remote Sensing Policy Act of 1992 is amended to emphasize the importance of Landsat data for global environmental research. The program will now be managed by a team from NASA, NOAA, and coordinated by the Office of Science and Technology Policy. Additionally, references to the Secretary of Defense are replaced with just "Secretary" and the Department of Defense is changed to the Department of Commerce in various sections. The Land Remote Sensing Policy Act of 1992 is amended to emphasize Landsat data for global environmental research. NASA, NOAA, and the Office of Science and Technology Policy will manage the program. Changes include replacing references to the Secretary of Defense with "Secretary" and updating the Department of Defense to the Department of Commerce. Additionally, adjustments are made to various sections regarding funding profiles and management plans. The Land Remote Sensing Policy Act of 1992 is amended to prioritize Landsat data for global environmental research. NASA, NOAA, and the Office of Science and Technology Policy will oversee the program. Changes include updating references to the Secretary of Defense, adjusting funding profiles, and modifying management plans. Amendments are made to sections regarding license issuance timelines and redesignating sections for clarity. The Land Remote Sensing Policy Act of 1992 is amended to prioritize Landsat data for global environmental research. Changes include updating references to the Secretary of Defense, adjusting funding profiles, and modifying management plans. Amendments are made to sections regarding license issuance timelines and specific actions required to obtain a license. The Land Remote Sensing Policy Act of 1992 is amended to prioritize Landsat data for global environmental research. Amendments include updating references to the Secretary of Defense, adjusting funding profiles, and modifying management plans. Changes are made to license issuance timelines and specific actions required to obtain a license. SEC. 206. NOTIFICATION. The Land Remote Sensing Policy Act of 1992 is amended to prioritize Landsat data for global environmental research. Amendments include updating references to the Secretary of Defense, adjusting funding profiles, and modifying management plans. Changes are made to license issuance timelines and specific actions required to obtain a license. Limitations on licensee actions and notification requirements to Congress are outlined. The Land Remote Sensing Policy Act of 1992 is amended to prioritize Landsat data for global environmental research. The Federal Communications Commission will ensure proportional licensing fees for private remote sensing space system operators. The Secretary of Defense shall consult on all matters under this Act. The Secretary of Defense must consult on national security matters under the Act and recommend conditions for licenses to protect US national security. The Secretary of State must consult on international obligations under the Act and recommend conditions for licenses. The Secretary of State shall recommend conditions for licenses to meet US international obligations. If no recommendations are received within 30 days, activities in the license application may be deemed consistent with US international obligations.
